intro: Alloplectus meridensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean thorned grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and sharp, spiny leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Alloplectus meridensis plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
